revised_title: Fossil Reptilian Inheritance in the Mammalian Hand: A Study of Theriodesmus phylarchus from Triassic Rocks of Klipfontein, Fraserberg, South Africa
tldr: The author examines a fossil reptile, Theriodesmus phylarchus, from Triassic rocks in South Africa, and identifies reptilian inheritance in the mammalian hand's structure and classification. The study provides insights into the evolution of mammals and their relation to reptiles during the Triassic period.
